questions.question: The Battle of Plassey (1757) was fought between the British East India Company and which ruler?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Plassey was fought between the British East India Company and Siraj-ud-Daulah.

questions.question: The Great Wall of China was primarily built during which dynasty?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China was primarily built during the Qin Dynasty.

questions.question: The Quit India Movement was launched in which year?
questions.explanation: The Quit India Movement was launched in 1942.

questions.question: The Indus Valley Civilization is best known for which urban feature?
questions.explanation: The Indus Valley Civilization is known for its advanced drainage systems.

questions.question: Who founded the Gupta dynasty?
questions.explanation: Chandragupta I founded the Gupta dynasty.

questions.question: Who was the first Mughal emperor of India?
questions.explanation: Babur was the first Mughal emperor of India.

questions.question: The American Civil War (1861–1865) was fought primarily over which issue?
questions.explanation: The American Civil War was fought primarily over the issue of slavery.

questions.question: The Treaty of Versailles (1919) officially ended which war?
questions.explanation: The Treaty of Versailles officially ended World War I.

questions.question: Who led the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia (1917)?
questions.explanation: Lenin led the Bolshevik Revolution in 1917.

questions.question: In India, who was the leader associated with the slogan “Do or Die”?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi gave the 'Do or Die' slogan during the Quit India Movement.

questions.question: The Meiji Restoration marked the modernization of which country?
questions.explanation: The Meiji Restoration marked the modernization of Japan.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington was the first President of the United States.

questions.question: Who was the ruler of the Maurya Empire at its peak of territorial expansion?
questions.explanation: Ashoka the Great was the ruler of the Maurya Empire at its peak.

questions.question: The French Revolution began in which year?
questions.explanation: The French Revolution began in 1789.

questions.question: The Hundred Years’ War was fought between which two countries?
questions.explanation: The Hundred Years’ War was a conflict between France and England.

questions.question: The Peloponnesian War was fought between Athens and which rival city-state?
questions.explanation: The Peloponnesian War was fought between Athens and Sparta.

questions.question: The Battle of Hastings (1066) established which dynasty in England?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Hastings established the Norman dynasty in England.

questions.question: The decline of the Roman Empire in the West is commonly dated to which year?
questions.explanation: The decline of the Western Roman Empire is commonly dated to 476 AD.

questions.question: Who was the Byzantine emperor who codified Roman law (Corpus Juris Civilis)?
questions.explanation: Justinian I was the Byzantine emperor who codified Roman law.

questions.question: The Taiping Rebellion occurred in which country?
questions.explanation: The Taiping Rebellion was a civil war in China.

questions.question: The Magna Carta was signed in which year?
questions.explanation: The Magna Carta was signed in 1215.

questions.question: Which Mughal ruler is credited with establishing Din-i Ilahi?
questions.explanation: Akbar is credited with establishing Din-i Ilahi.

questions.question: The Congress of Vienna (1814–1815) aimed to restore balance in Europe after whose defeat?
questions.explanation: The Congress of Vienna aimed to restore balance in Europe after Napoleon's defeat.

questions.question: The Bosnian Crisis of 1908 involved the annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina by which empire?
questions.explanation: The Austro-Hungarian Empire annexed Bosnia and Herzegovina during the Bosnian Crisis.

questions.question: Who was the Indian revolutionary leader hanged in 1931 along with Rajguru and Sukhdev?
questions.explanation: Bhagat Singh was hanged in 1931 along with his comrades Rajguru and Sukhdev.

questions.question: Which empire was ruled by Genghis Khan?
questions.explanation: Genghis Khan ruled the Mongol Empire.

questions.question: The Spanish Armada was defeated by which country in 1588?
questions.explanation: The Spanish Armada was defeated by England in 1588.

questions.question: The Berlin Conference (1884–1885) regulated European colonization of which continent?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Conference regulated the colonization of Africa.

questions.question: Who was the founder of the Ottoman Empire?
questions.explanation: Osman I was the founder of the Ottoman Empire.

questions.question: The Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962 was a standoff between the USA and which country?
questions.explanation: The Cuban Missile Crisis was a standoff between the USA and the USSR.
